reviews.review_msg: One of the worst classes ive taken at SFU so far. The format of the course is so old, half of the material/websites have been updated or cant be found anymore. Way too many readings assigned, along with hours of documentaries for the weekly response. Weekly responses and term paper due the same day. Do not take this course.

Ok arch majors, do not take this course. Way too much work for too little reward. The content is actually super interesting but the course requires a huge time commitment. I lucked out on my TA, but even though I found the material interesting MAJOR regrets taking this course. NOT a GPA booster, and the course itself needs a revamp. Format is bad.

Worst prof in SFU. Super bias on grading students. If you are not a social type, pls do not take this course cuz she only likes those who willing to social with her. Exams are insanely hard, pure memorizing on tons of materials

Great professor, horrible course curriculum. This class was not catered to keep anyone taking more than 2 other courses in mind as the due dates are unreasonable and the amount of reading is ridiculous. Her passion is there 100%, but the course needs to be revised.
Very helpful professor, she will spend extra time if you share your struggle with her. Helped me through one of the course I struggled most. Would have failed the course if the professor didn't help.

Since this is an online class, Barbara has nothing to do with it. Therefore, it is mainly the TA, Katie, who I am rating. Overall, the class has a lot of writing and as previously mentioned, the papers and assignments are often due on the same day. However, Katie was a super fast marker and gave great comments. The test was hard, but marked fairly

A very difficult course for those who are not archeology students. Writing extensive but only three credits given. There is no notes given and the professor never show up. All questions are answered by the tutor. Weekly responses (500words) and paper (3000words) are due at the same day. Not recommended.

Ridiculous professor. Parameters are extremely unclear and hard. Expects so much from textbook. In total, about 400 pages worth of reading. No notes. Marking is weird. My GPA is 4.21 at SFU. I got a B- in this course. so don take this course if you your looking for a GPA booster

She has minimal involvement in the online course. You only receive announcements from the tutor. She has an extremely ridiculous schedule for due dates. Major paper, midterm, and weekly assignment all due in one week and at times on same day. Favours archaeology students. prof cares more about word counts than students learning  about archaeology.

While I had a good experience with barb in this class, my following experience was the worst I have ever had in a class. She is awful at communicating with her students and is jaded from all of her years of being stuff in the museum and not hired on as faculty. She is out of touch with curating and needs to retire.
She is a really mean professor that I ever met. I can not believe there is such a professor like this in sfu.
I loved Barb! Tough final exam, but other than that, its a pretty relaxed atmosphere. Obviously has a love for the subject and it passed on to me
Nice and funny personality but seems kind of condescending when you ask her questions. Also seemed to favour ARCH students over others. Quizzes are easy but her teaching method needs to improve.
Awesome professor
Excellent prof.! Very approachable and helpful!

Wouldn't recommend. Weirdly obsessed with threatening students about using AI. Insane amount of required readings + lecture videos, but can't really blame her considering it's a condensed courseâ€¦ Except a lot of the material wasn't even quizzed on because she'd focus on asking about the smallest details on a piece of art or from a YouTube video.

worst elective i have ever taken.
i could've taken a cinema course instead. 
not passionate about arch, now i am never going to take another arch course.
I don't see a point of image based quizzes. I am not learning from them. There were questions about what a random nobody said in a quiz. I truly think this course requires revision.

This is an unbiased review - she is not accommodating at all. She has recorded lectures from another prof (which are good) but her lectures are no opinion based, and unclear. She asked questions on the quiz from a background image in her lectures. Why would students go over the background images at all? Avoid. There are better electives.

The whole course is a joke. The prof wants the threaten students but her whole course is just copy and paste. They wanna talk about critical thinking , when the quiz is like what was the color of something after 3  modules of 4 lectures each (40min each), the most meaningless questions ever
She wanted to sue us for content she did not create. idk what wrong with her.
Don't. Period. Just don't
Worst ever! Did nothing! Never care about students' problems when they need help! Avoid!
It feels like she jiust shows up to threaten the students! the worst class ever TAKEN! The way the professor thinks she is actually teaching is crazy, cause in reality she does not do anything.
The worst class ever taken! I think the prof actually needs to make her own material and power points, cause in reality it does not seems she is actually teaching. Cause she is not!

Definitely not good!Boring lectures ( which are not even done by the prof) just recycled material. She is not even there other than threaten the students about AI. Not flexible at all! There is so many content in each module, and you can't miss any detail cause the quiz are the most RANDOM questions. I feel like I learned more with Youtube videos.

OMG don't! Please. I am usually a high achiever but what the hell was this? Took it as an elective but i don't know whats wrong with the prof? Like so much content? its an intersession so please understand we are students and we have other things to do as well, other than studying your course. So boring, I didnt like lectures she gave. i dont recom
There was so much content information in the lectures. Each quiz was very difficult and she tested us on irrelevant details and images. She sent out an email saying she can sue us if we use AI

The WORST course I have taken in my undergrad. Quizzes were closed book, and the questions were so specific. SO MUCH content, each module took me about 3-4 hours because you could not miss a single piece of info. Lectures are from another professor, not her, making it feel like she is not even teaching the course. avoid.

She replaced some of the original course videos with her videos. These new videos are about her opinions and nothing worth of remembering. She does not look at anything you submit, despite what she says in the videos and emails. The quizzes are filled with braindead questions like asking what some random nobody was doing in a YouTube video.

This class is NOT a GPA booster. The prof does nothing except send a few emails here and there (the lectures are recorded by another prof, quizzes are auto-graded and assignments are marked by TAs). The 4 "image" quizzes are very misleading as the image has nothing to do with the question. TAs also mark very harshly for no valid reason.

this class appears straightforward and she seemed caring and understanding but she will explicitly tell you certain material isnt on the quizzes and is optional but put it in the quiz anyways, extremely heavy on readings.
Deceptive person that pretends but actually does not care about the course material. Fortunately, the lecture videos were recorded by someone else.

Whoever said this was a GPA booster fully lied. TAs do all the marking, some mark SUPER easy but others literally nitpick you so much. My friend and I worked together and got drastically different marks bc we had different TAs. This class just sucked, take literally anything else if you're looking for an upper div elective.

I do not know Laurie's role in being professor in this course. It's online delivery, and the lectures are pre-recorded featuring the previous professors lectures. The TA's are your only point of contact, they do all the grading, and Laurie is not very accessible. I am an ARCH/ANTH major, and usually get good grades, not so so- far in this course.

You can tell that Laurie genuinely cares about her students and tries her best to set up a learning environment that reflects this. She is accommodating & sweet. I am not an ARCH major, but I found this class really interesting and manageable. There's 4 quizzes, discussion posts and a final paper - I would take a class again with her for sure! :)

Laurie is the best prof for this course, she is very passionate about the topic and puts in the effort to help and solidify topics that may be unclear. This class consisted of discussion posts, image quizzes, and two assignments. Definitely stay on top of the readings and lectures, and ask questions. This class is well designed too!
